titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) Gubernatorial records,Audiovisual materials, Series 39
A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial records, Audiovisual materials, Series 39 FA756

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-02-05 00:04:10 -0500.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial records, Audiovisual materials, Series 39

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The contents of this series has been separated from other archival holdings. As such, the description of any individual item, or set of items, may also currently appear, in some form, in the finding aid for the originating collection.
Future processing, description, and presentation of films will seek to address this issue as much as feasible.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

All inquiries to view films require advanced notice of at least 2 business days, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those that are not available in modern formats, may be restricted from access at the discretion of RAC.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Audiovisual material (motion picture film, video, and audio recordings) pertaining to NAR's gubernatorial and political career.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in subseries by media type (film, video) and chronologically by creation date.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller, Political Films

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage from campaigns, conventions, and official events that are specifically related to political activities in the life of NAR. Many dozens of campaign commercials, including TV and radio spots.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Many dozens of campaign commercials, including TV and radio spots, are included in the NAR collection but have recieved only basic processing. â€“ see Special Formats staff for more information.

scopecontent.p: produced by the Miller Brewing Company, footage of awards dinner with Governor Nelson Rockefeller and other speakers, featuring Miller High Life beers as sponsor. Also has footage of the Puerto Rico Day Parade in Manhattan.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller: Newsreel Compilation from Fox News

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A newsreel compilation from 1958 of Nelson A. Rockefeller gubernatorial footage. Includes footage of Nelson A. Rockefeller in New York City at a reception for his gubernatorial campaign, Dwight D. Eisenhower arriving in New York City, Nelson A. Rockefeller and Dwight D. Eisenhower in 5th Avenue parade, John D. Rockefeller 3rd with Senator Keating, construction of the Interfaith Center, Nelson A. Rockefeller family portrait, President Eisenhower with Nelson Rockefeller, Nelson A. Rockefeller and David Kennedy, Nelson A. Rockefeller campaiging in Glen Falls, New York. Nelson A. Rockefeller and wife visiting Venezuela. Nelson A. Rockefeller in Albany, New York at swearing in ceremony and celeration. Mrs. Nelson A. Rockefeller and Nelson sewing union labels on clothing.

did.unittitle: Dewey Endorsement of Republican Candidates

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1958 campaign, Thomas Dewey's endorsements of candidates Nelson Rockefeller, Wilson, Keating, and Lefkowitz, shot by CBS.

did.unittitle: Making of the President

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Based on the book by Theodore H. White, this documentary film follows the campaigns of Nixon and John F. Kennedy during the 1960 presidential election, with news footage of Nelson Rockefeller, Hubert Humphreys, and others. Produced by David Wolper for ABC-TV news.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

did.unittitle: 1960 National Campaign: "Leadership", "Economic Growth", "Equal Opportunity", "Foreign Policy"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Titles include E-20-15 LEADERSHIP; E-20-16 ECONOMIC GROWTH; E-20-17 EQUAL OPPORTUNITY; E-20-18 FOREIGN POLICY.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: ALSO SEE III 14.1 Fa 81 (AV 1232); COMPILED ON ONE REEL WITH AV #1232-1234.

did.unittitle: National Campaign: GOP National Convention

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Footage of Barry M. Goldwater's speech at the 1960 GOP Convention, withdrawing his candidacy in support of Richard Nixon. Goldwater speaks about the history and purpose of the Republican party, and asks for unity within the party.

did.unittitle: Nelson Rockefeller: The Man and His Record

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Campaign film produced during the 1963 gubernatorial race. Includes brief 'life history of NAR and footage of him at Princeton, Rockefeller Center, and in Latin America. Showcases NAR's experiences, shows him with political associates, amid NY industries and farms, visiting SUNY schools and as commissioner of the Human Rights Office.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. did.unittitle: The Time is Now

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Political film produced by the Republican National Finance Committee before the 1966 election. Discusses domestic and international issues that have been caused by the Democratic majority in the U.S., with sound bites from Eisenhower, Ford, Nixon, Gov. Rockefeller, and others.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

did.unittitle: Friend of the Rockefeller Team: Campaign Commercials 1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Compilation of 31 political ads from 1966 campaign, ranging from 10 to 60 seconds each. Topics include: Pure Water Program, state scholarships, the Bureau of Consumer Protection, Medicaid, the narcotics reform laws, education, minimum wage, air pollution, and a message from Jacob Javits.

did.unittitle: Four Stars on the Issues

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discussion with Vice President Richard Nixon, New York State Govenor Nelson A. Rockefeller, and New York Senators Jacob K. Javits and Kenneth B. Keating on the issues New York citizens have stated are important to them in this election. CBS Production # 10-2785-1019

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Unedited videotape. First 2:30 minutes no image, low volume. Program begins at 3:20.

did.unittitle: NAR: Vote For Louis Lefkowitz, NYC Mayor (For Crime) - Take 3
Election Eve: Wrap-Up!

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Post-election roundtable discussion with the Rockefeller team summarizing the entire campaign. Speakers include: Marcus G. Christ, John P. Lomenzo, Louis J. Lefkowitz, Malcolm Wilson, Jacob K. Javits, and Nelson A. Rockefeller.

did.unittitle: Pre-Convention Legislative Reports I

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Episode of Victory Vanguard that looks at the 1962 state election, with Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller. Program sponsored by the New York Republican State Committee.

did.unittitle: School Aid - Take 7, Governor Rockefeller Campaign Spot
did.physdesc: Sound, Black and white, 1 min. 35 sec.

did.unittitle: Education - College Education Booklet - Take 7
did.physdesc: Sound, Black and white, 1 min. 45 sec.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: NAR urges viewers to obtain a copy of "Help For Your College Education, 1963-1964."

did.unittitle: 1964 California Primary: The Extremists

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Program features Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller, Dave Garroway, and others discussing the efforts of right-wing extremists to influence and/or control the California Republican State Party.

did.unittitle: Executive Chamber, Number 1: How Much Education?

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: New York State Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller and education professionals discusses the need for education and the state of the New York State schools.

did.unittitle: Executive Chamber, Number 3: In The Name of the People

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In his annual message to the legislature, Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller recommends solutions to the problems facing the people of New York State. These include: issues of education on all levels, water pollution abatement, per capita aid, traffic safety, and full crew law. The Governor also relates how state laws are made.

did.unittitle: Oregon Campaign - Citizens' Questions and Answers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Oregon citizens meet one-on-one with Nelson A. Rockefeller in an outdoor forum to ask their questions.

did.unittitle: 1964 California Republican Presidential Primary: Report to Rockefeller

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller presents his views on the issues of interest and concern to the Republican voters of California. He is joined by Senator John McCarthy, Assemblyman Milton Marks, Assembly man John Veneman, Assemblyman George Milias, and Assemblyman William Bagley.

did.unittitle: Governor Nelson Rockefeller on Liquor Law Reform

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Governor Nelson Rockefeller discusses liquor law reform after corruption occurs in New York State. Program presented and paid for by N.Y. State Citizens Committee for Liquor Reform. Air date: 1964 April 11.

did.unittitle: Governor Rockefeller Campaign Compilation Reel - 2
did.physdesc: Sound, Black and white, 10 min. 30 sec.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes the following spots: Cuba, Small Business, Leadership Gap, Economic Growth, and the Republican Party.

did.unittitle: Governor Rockefeller Campaign Compilation Reel - 1
did.physdesc: Sound, Black and white, 7 min. 45 sec.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes the following spots: Welfare, Withdrawing Recognition, and the United Nations.

did.unittitle: Oregon Campaign Film

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Film with Nelson A. Rockefeller and Happy Rockefeller campaigning in Oregon.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Contains silent footage at end of program.

did.unittitle: Meet Nelson Rockefeller

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Audio buzz throughout.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A primary television special for New Hampshire voters on WMUR-TV. Program includes "The Nelson Rockefeller Story" and candidate Rockefeller speaks directly to the televison viewers.

did.unittitle: Executive Chamber, Number 4: The View from the Governor's Chair

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: New York State Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller reports in detail about the New York State annual budget. Several key figures speak about their requested funding including: Dr. William J. Ronan from the Tri-State Transportation Committee, Lawrence W. Pierce from the Division of Youth, J. Burch McMorran, Supt. of Public Works, George K. Wyman, Commissioner of Social Welfare, John Hathorn from the Office of Indian Affairs, Dr. James E. Allen, Commissioner of Education, and Dr. Henry Brill, Director of Pilgrim State Hospital. Captain John C. Miller of the Oneida Barracks N.Y. State Police requests a $150 increase for dog food.

did.unittitle: Executive Chamber, Number 6: Transportation Tangle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: New York State Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller discusses the creation of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) and the Federal Department of Transportation.

did.unittitle: Executive Chamber, Number 7: Troubled Mind

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: New York State Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller and health professionals discusses mental illness, the need to create new facilities, and the progress of New York State hospitals.

did.unittitle: Executive Chamber, Number 8: A Walk in the Glen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: New York State Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller profiles Watkins Glen, New York, to show a small community and its problems and achievements. Some stories from locals and a visit to the Watkins Glen cemetery and Watkins Glen National Park.

did.unittitle: Governor Rockefeller Reviews the 1965 Legislature

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Begins with 1 minute of NBC test pattern and tones. Image quality poor. Image progressively gets worse throughout duration of tape.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Govenor Nelson A. Rockefeller gives his opinions about what has transpired in the New York state capitol during the 1965 Legislative session.

did.unittitle: Thomas E. Dewey Talks About Governor Nelson Rockefeller

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Silent footage at beginning. Program begins at 1 minute 40 seconds.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From the Cotillion Room at the Sheraton Hotel in Rochester, New York, the former three term governor of New York State, Thomas E. Dewey, encourages Republicans to vote to re-elect Nelson Rockefeller.

did.unittitle: Nelson and Winthrop Rockefeller Nominating Segments

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From the 1968 Republican National Convention, Gerald Ford introduces Governor Raymond P. Shafer who nominates Nelson A. Rockefeller for Republican candidate for President. Rockefeller speaks. Also speaking: Winthrop Rockefeller, and others.

Governor Nelson Rockefeller's Special News Conference on Narcotics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller's press conference in Albany, New York regarding the drug problem in New York state. Speakers include: Reverend Oberia D. Dempsey, Reverend Earl B. Moore, Glester Hinds, Dr. George W. McMurray, and Dr. Robert W. Baird. A question and answer session with the press concludes the program.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The video begins with 40 seconds of color bars and tones.

did.unittitle: Senator's Report

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From Washington, a report to Pennsylvania from the U.S. Senate by Senator Hugh Scott. Scott answers questions from his three guests from the press.

did.unittitle: Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller Press Conference: Resignation as Governor of New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Excerpts from a press conference where Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller discusses his resignation as New York state governor. Event takes place in the Red Room of the state capital.

did.unittitle: Governor Nelson Rockefeller: Appearance on the Today Show - Discussing New York State Drug Laws

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Governor Rockefeller's appearance on the Today Show where he discusses newly implemented drugs laws with host Barbara Walters.

scopecontent.p: Exterior and interior footage of Kyikuit, a 40-room house in Westchester County, New York, built by John D. Rockefeller.
